question: 形
sourceAnswer:
<read>かたち</read>|<read>よう</read>:: form/shape/figure | visage
<read>けい</read>:: form/tense | adjective/i-adjective-(in-Japanese)
sourceMnemonic: The kanji and the word are exactly the same. That means they share meanings as well.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
Since this word is made up of a single kanji, it should use the kun'yomi reading. You haven't learned this reading yet, so here's a mnemonic to help you:

You really want to eat food that's in neat <vocabulary>shape</vocabulary>s, so you decide to use a <reading>cutter</reading> (<ja>かた</ja>) on your <reading>chee</reading>se (<ja>ち</ja>) to make it a new shape. Square cheese is so boring. After you cut it up you have mouse shaped cheese! It just tastes better like that.
